title: Power - object traveling up incline constant speed

content.question: A <math alttext="0.250 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0.250</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mstyle></math> cart is being pushed up a track that is inclined at <math alttext="30 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">Â°</mi></math> above the horizontal as shown. Friction between the cart and the track is negligible. Calculate the minimum power required to push the cart up the track at a constant speed of <math alttext="2.4 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.4</mn><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
